newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Sweden's Riksbank buys crowns for mark.
newsitem.headline: Sweden's Riksbank buys crowns for mark.

text.p: The Swedish central bank, the Riksbank, bought crowns for marks on Friday, according to foreign exchange dealers.
"The crown is firmer because the central bank has stepped in," a trader told Reuters.
The move follows a sharp weakening of the crown in the past three days with the crown dropping to 4.4250 just before midday on Friday from 4.3520 per mark late on Tuesday.
At 1310 GMT, the crown changed hands at 4.4215 per mark.
The Riksbank has said it is part of its policy to enter the market to smooth out large fluctuations. It does not usually comment on interventions.
